page.title: 13CHANGING TIMES IN RIPON CONT
page.content: 1925 CONT... Duffield's timber yard now occupies this site. Where my school is now was once a field called the Agricultural field, this was used for fairs and shows. In November there was a festival called Martinmas,during which the workers came down from the farms to Studley and waited for the farmers to hire them for the next year. Women wore straight up and down dresses and never went out without a floppy-brimmed hat.Men wore Oxford "bags"and"union"shirts and braces. 1945 When the men returned from the war there were still many of Ripon's old cottages left but many of these were replaced by Council housing.There were ballrooms,cinemas and opera houses but in 20 years these had gone too.
